private_information: I am the primary actor reading the use-case. I know the set of primitive actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Each action is parameterized over objects (object_0 ... object_14 may appear).

I know, in human terms, the preconditions and effects for each action as stated in the use-case. My role is to extract a clean, structured action schema (preconditions and add/delete effects) and to verify the proposed plan fragments against those schemas.
player.goal: Produce a structured model (action schemas and a mapping of object identifiers) that captures the preconditions and effects described in the use-case so that another agent can synthesize a PDDL domain.

private_information: I hold detailed initial-state and goal statements and the sequence of planned actions provided in the two STATEMENT blocks. I can enumerate initial facts, desired goal facts, and the proposed plan steps exactly as written.

My responsibility is to produce a clean representation of the two scenario instances: (1) the initial facts, goal, and plan for the first statement; (2) the initial facts, goal, and plan for the second statement. I will not emit PDDL, only structured instance descriptions.
observer.goal: Emit two structured problem instances (initial facts, object list, goal facts, and plan trace) suitable for a downstream agent that will translate them into PDDL problems.

private_information: I coordinate the information coming from the player and the observer. I must integrate the extracted action schemas and the problem instances into a consistent multi-agent PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files.

I must keep action names and parameter roles consistent, preserve distinctions if the two sources name objects differently, and produce PDDL suited for the Fast Downward planner (classical STRIPS/ADL as appropriate).
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files targeted for the FastDownward solver that reflect the scenarios and support verification of the provided plans.

public_information: Actions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Each action takes object parameters as described in the human specification.
paltry requires: hand ?o0, cats ?o1, texture ?o2, vase ?o0 ?o1, next ?o1 ?o2. paltry adds: next ?o0 ?o2. paltry deletes: vase ?o0 ?o1.
sip requires: hand ?o0, cats ?o1, texture ?o2, next ?o0 ?o2, next ?o1 ?o2. sip adds: vase ?o0 ?o1. sip deletes: next ?o0 ?o2.
clip requires: hand ?o0, sneeze ?o1, texture ?o2, next ?o1 ?o2, next ?o0 ?o2. clip adds: vase ?o0 ?o1. clip deletes: next ?o0 ?o2.
wretched requires: sneeze ?o0, texture ?o1, texture ?o2, stupendous ?o3, next ?o0 ?o1, collect ?o1 ?o3, collect ?o2 ?o3. wretched adds: next ?o0 ?o2. wretched deletes: next ?o0 ?o1.
memory requires: cats ?o0, spring ?o1, spring ?o2, next ?o0 ?o1. memory adds: next ?o0 ?o2. memory deletes: next ?o0 ?o1.
tightfisted requires: hand ?o0, sneeze ?o1, texture ?o2, next ?o1 ?o2, vase ?o0 ?o1. tightfisted adds: next ?o0 ?o2. tightfisted deletes: vase ?o0 ?o1.

The use-case contains two separate scenario statements: each defines initial facts, a goal (conjunction of next facts), and a multiline plan. Object identifiers range across object_0 through object_14 in the examples.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst agent. Read the environment public information and the use-case action descriptions. Produce a precise, structured representation of the action schemas in JSON form: for each action name list parameters, preconditions (positive atoms), add effects, and delete effects. Do not emit PDDL. Keep parameter positions consistent across schemas and label parameters as ?o0, ?o1, etc. The output artifact name is model_player.
analyze.prompt: Your name is player. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge: {agents->player->private_information} to extract action schemas and any ambiguities you detect. Output a JSON-style action schema artifact that includes action names, parameter lists, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects. If some facts in the use-case are underspecified, flag them but do not invent missing relations.

summarize.system_prompt: You are an observer that extracts instance data. From each STATEMENT block in the use-case produce a structured problem instance containing the explicit object list, initial facts (as a list of ground predicates), goal facts, and the provided plan as a sequence of grounded action applications. Do not emit PDDL.
summarize.prompt: Your name is observer. Use your private information: {agents->observer->private_information} and the public information: {environment->public_information} to produce two structured scenario artifacts. Name them scenario1 and scenario2 and ensure each contains objects, initial_facts, goal_facts, and plan_steps exactly as given in the use-case.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL engineer preparing inputs for the Fast Downward planner. Receive the structured action schemas from model_player and the two scenario instances from model_observer. Integrate them into a single PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files. Keep action names and parameter roles consistent and preserve the distinction between actions coming from different sources. Target Fast Downward: produce STRIPS/ADL-compatible PDDL that Fast Downward can parse. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem-s1></problem-s1> and <problem-s2></problem-s2> tags. The final output artifact name is pddl_orchestrator.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive model_player: {model_player} and model_observer: {model_observer}. Integrate these inputs, resolve naming ambiguities, and emit a PDDL domain and two PDDL problems suitable for Fast Downward. Ensure the produced domain includes predicates for hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring and any others used; include all action schemas with their add and delete lists derived from model_player. For each scenario create a problem file declaring objects, initial facts, and goal facts as extracted. Enclose domain and problems in the requested tags.
